New Records: Anthony Edwards scored 32 points with seven 3-pointers, marking his ninth 30-point game this season.
Zion Williamson returned from a 27-game absence and contributed 22 points, six rebounds, four assists, three steals, and a block in 27 minutes.
Key Match Events: Anthony Edwards' 19-2 run in the third quarter turned the game in Minnesota's favor.
Zion Williamson showcased his return with impressive plays including two Murray-steal-induced dunks.
Dejounte Murray scored 29 points for the Pelicans, while CJ McCollum struggled with a 1-of-14 performance.
Post-Match Reflections: Minnesota coach highlighted the victory as a strong team effort and noted Williamson's impact.
Zion Williamson's return was a significant moment for the Pelicans.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Donte DiVincenzo started at point guard for Minnesota, and Mike Conley rested, contributing eight points as a reserve.
The game was closely contested, with Minnesota leading by as many as 13 points early on.
Others: The final score was 104-97 in favor of the Timberwolves, with the under 221.5 being the final line.
Key takeaways included Williamson and Murray's chemistry and Edwards' strong performance.
